Description: Fragment from shoulder and neck of pottery closed vessel (oenochoe?): two antithetical lions, seemingly rampant over large half-rosette, in black-figure and added red, with filling motifs; on neck, meander band. Interior reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From the same vase as Brussels A2046
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224, no. 112)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 108, pl. XXXIV, no. 320.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.968)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5957 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
